column4: I'm trying to install MythTV... should I download precompiled debian sources, or compiile myself using sources (keeping in mind I'm a noob)?
asked differently - do debain precompiled packages work in ubuntu?
what's wrong with using the ubuntu mythtv packags?
I installed the ubuntu mythtv packages, and had no problems
didnt realise there were mythtv unbuntu packages... will have to look around, thanks for the pointer
they're all in multiverse.  There are several packages.
do I just use the Synaptic Package Manager to install it?
sounds like there's a 'but...' (is there some better way to install it?)
cool, thx. Esxcept, I can't find mythtv in the list (I'm look in ALL)
you need to make sure you have multiverse enabled
if you don't have it enabled, see here; http://www.ubuntulinux.org/wiki/AddingRepositoriesHowto
Followed instructions on that website, and now i have a bunch of (Universe) packages, but I couldnt find anything for Multiverse
we need to add "multiverse" then too
There wasn't a multiverse checkbox option in the repositry list (even when I changed the setting to display hidden repositories)
